description:
Guides to the Evaluation of Permanent Impairment, Fourth Edition

American Medical Association (Author)

Guides to the Evaluation of Permanent Impairment, Fourth Edition, is the leading medical reference for understanding, evaluating and reporting on medical impairments. Widely recognized as the most reliable source on impairment evaluation, Guides offers a complete, standardized system for clinicians.

Edition/Year: Fourth 
Publisher: American Medical Association 
Hardcover,  8Ã‚Â½" x 11",  339 pages 
ISBN#: 0-89970-553-7 
Item#: OP025493 

Uses

For a complete, standardized system for understanding and assessing impairment, Guides to the Evaluation of Permanent Impairment, Fourth Edition, is the go-to resource for clinicians and health care professionals.

Covering every body system, it is highly valued for the validity of its fundamental medical and scientific concepts, its universally applicable analytical approach, and its detailed medical evaluation protocol.

Clinicians may benefit from Guides Fourth for understanding and using impairment information appropriately.

Features

The fourth edition of Guides to the Evaluation of Permanent Impairment includes:

Insight into regulatory issues
In-depth case reports and examples
Adverse effects of pharmaceuticals
Organ transplant information
A complete chapter on pain
